Project Portfolio

Technetium

JavaScript • Python • Django • D3 • Bitbucket API

A Bitbucket data aggregation tool built using Bitbucket's RESTful API. Features a centralized issue tracker, repository subscription manager, and reports/graphs which enumerate the commit/issue activity of each user in a subscribed repository.

Technetium's frontend is build using Twitter Bootstrap. The centralized issue tracker gathers data through Bitbucket's API endpoints, and is sped up considerably using Python's gevents library for sending asynchronous requests, while being highly responsive using AJAX to load/filter issue data.

Live Demo | Read More


Smarthouse For Everyone

JavaScript • NodeJS • Arduino • iOS • C • Django • Python

A plug-an-play device for remote control of anything that is plugged into it. The motiviation behind this project is to allow home automation for the visually impaired and physically challenged.

Read More

Features:

  • Custom Node.JS RESTful API
  • Custom Hardware build on top of an Arduino Mega
  • iOS Application with gesture recognition and voice control

Super Mario World - Koopa Krisis

ImpactJS • JavaScript • HTML5

A Super Mario World Clone built using JavaScript on top of the ImpactJS game engine, purely for educational purposes.

Features:

  • Powerup System
  • Collectable Items
  • Custom Overworld
  • Over 10 custom levels
  • Over 28 custom enemies with different Artificial Intelligences
  • Custom boss with increasingly difficult Artificial Intelligence

Live Demo | Source Code | Read More

El-Gamal Attack

Cryptography • Python

A Python project with explores the semantic secureness of pycrypto's implementation of El Gamal. Using the Chinese Remainder Theorem, we can determine that some of the information of a transmitted message M is leaked. This information is efficiently computable by an adversary, showing that pycrypo's El Gamal implementation is not semantically secure.

Fire Emblem - Chronicles of the Abyss

JavaScript • ImpactJS • HTML5

A new game development project as part of the CCNY ACM's Game Development Club. The motivation of this project is to create a JavaScript remake of Fire Emblem - Blazing Sword, which is playable using only the browser and the mouse, as well as to push the boundaries and limitations of the ImpactJS Game Engine.

Current Features:

  • Enemy Item Drops
  • Custom Artwork and Music
  • Consumable Items/ Item Usage
  • Playable with just the mouse
  • Enemy Artificial Intelligence
  • Animation and Terrain systems
  • Weapon Triangle / Weapon Durability
  • Inventory / Trade / Equipment system
  • Completely custom Graphical User Interface
  • Character development system / stats system
  • Normal Attack / Critical Attack / Magic system
  • A-star pathfinding algorithms for enemy/player movement
  • Ability to detect adjacent enemy/players, as well as attack/heal

Read More

Caesium

JavaScript • Node.js • Redis • Python • Socket.io

A real-time notification system built for integration into Graphyte, an ongoing research project at the G.L.A.S.S Lab at the City College of New York.

By using Node.js in combination with both its socket.io and redis client, a simple notification streaming system can be built using Redis's pubsub implementation. Whenever a new client is connected to Graphyte, they are automatically subscribed to a new channel through the Node.js Redis client, and can then recieve messages in real-time to get feedback on their homework solutions.

Read More

Sea Ice Mapping

Python • Numpy • Scipy • Theano • Deep Learning

A joint research project with NOAA-CREST and NASA to map sea ice structures on satellite images provided by MODIS. My roles involve getting training data through marking up supplied images, as well as exploring more automated classification methods using various Deep Learning algorithms built on top of Theano.
